titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. David Roberts, Indictment
CWG0942

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
INDICTMENT.
Licking Valley Scorcher Print, West Liberty, Ky.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky, Plff.
against Indictment for
David Roberts Deft.
Morgan CIRCUIT COURT, TERM, 188.

The Grand Jury of Morgan County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse David Roberts of the offense of Murder committed in manner and form as follows, viz: The said David Roberts did, on the 1st day of October, 18864, in the county aforesaid did Wilfully and feloniously & with malice aforethought Kill and murder One James. L. Kendall by Cutting him with a Knife and Strikeing him with a rock or some other hard substance and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

J. S. Dury
Commonwealth's Attorney, District Ky.

A True Copy
Att J. A. Lacy Clerk, M, C, C,

Commonwealth
vs
David Roberts
$300 offerrd
May 112
